website_summaries.verdict: There is a learning curve with the 4-pump ratcheting action, but these loppers do a great job with larger limbs and harder woods. A bit heavy, so better suited for larger users.
pros: Blades are extremely sharp and durable
Aluminum handles are lightweight and telescope for additional reach
cons: Difficult to find replacement handles and blades
Ratcheting action requires 4 pumps of the handle per cut

customer_reviews.title: too heavy and poor design
customer_reviews.text: i don't see any value in this since it is a rachet and heavy so you have to click it several times befor you can clip off some branches. should have returned it
customer_reviews.author: 50rocks

customer_reviews.title: These are absolutely the best quality loppers I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely the best quality loppers I have ever owned, and I have had a few in my 57 years! These made my annual job of pruning my six crape myrtles so much easier I cannot believe I have done without these all these years. Crape myrtle limbs are very hard to cut. Some of mine were at least 12 feet in length and up to 2 inches in diameter and these loppers had no problem. I had already worked out my arms at the gym so I got an extra workout tonight. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Hoskins

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy but WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: This lopper is a little heavy but on my gosh, the ratcheting action sure makes a 2 inch limb easy to take down!! It extends easily and locks in with twists of the grips, so i can reach up to fairly high limbs. I had to figure out the action of the ratchet system, but once I did, no limb up to 2 inches, was safe. Like I said, it's pretty substantial, but it is manageable for me, as i'm used to the heavy stuff. It is a really good tool and I think it will be hard to break. I'd buy it again, at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT - Great tool, Great price, currently out of stock
customer_reviews.text: Tool is simple but effective. Extending handles are a delight, either for more leverage or just a longer reach. I did have a slight problem outside of the Amazon return window, but it has a 10-year warranty. Expecting a run-around, I was really pleased, the manufacturer was totally responsive and took care of things. I know they're out of stock because I wanted to buy a second set for myself, and another for my new-homeowner son. I hope they are available again, otherwise I'll have to spend >$100 to get them from England. Which I'll do if I have to!
customer_reviews.author: Not Born Yesterday

customer_reviews.title: Well Engineered!
customer_reviews.text: The ratcheting mechanism on these pruners/loppers performs very smoothly by comparison to the more typical open notched rachet seen on most pruners. The locking mechanism for the extending handles appears to be superior as well. I would not have expected this kind of performance from such light tool. Thanks to those who reviewed them before for making that clear. It took me awhile to pick up on the fact that anvil loppers have some advantages over bypass loppers and vice versa. I am pleased to have added this tool to my collection of garden tools.
customer_reviews.author: Critical Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Needs cocking to work
customer_reviews.text: I had some difficulty after taking this out of the package in getting it to open properly. It takes a couple of half cocks before the blade pops opens. I tested it on some voluntary saplings and it cuts nicely although you must ratchet it while you are cutting or else it won't finish the cut. I cut some trees over 3'"in diameter, no problem. I might also get the Wolf tele Bypass lopper as well since it telescopes and I don't believe it needs cocking. Seems to be sturdy and is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John3

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with these!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pruners. I have already worn out a similar pair and have been looking for a replacement. Once you get used to using them you won't want to use any other pruner. I have a small yard care business and I have bought many tools. These are a good buy and less expensive than from other sellers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ward

customer_reviews.title: Scarey good
customer_reviews.text: These loppers have proven to be perfect for thick, tough, dry branches. The telescoping arms are great for added leverage as well as long reach. I do not use these for my everyday pruning, as the ratcheting motion that makes these so great for the tough stuff, makes it more work for the minor items. So, I use a standard set of lopping shears for the normal stuff, and when the going gets rough, out come the Spear and Jacksons! These things look like they will be one of those lifetime tools that I will hand down to my kids in 20 years - they are well made, and do the work with a minimum of effort.
customer_reviews.author: JavaReader

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: I might update this later after a lot more use, but so far this is working better than I expected. It has a ratchet feature where you open the arms, it pops open, and then you ratchet it almost like a socket wrench about 3-4 times until it cuts. Sounds terrible, but when cutting 2-3" weeds that are too big for my lopper, but too small for my bow-saw, it is very quick--much quicker than anything other than maybe a chainsaw?
customer_reviews.author: just a buyer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I got these for all of the trees on our property. They are GREAT! I always seem to abuse the tools I have so I have buy good quality. I have cleared a whole bunch of sapplings that I allowed to get out of control; I didn't measure them, but I am sure some were greater than two inches as I had to do a double kind of turn cut. They performed perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent loppers. High build quality, work great.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned quite a few ratcheting loppers. This is by far the best. Others always have difficulty shifting from one ratchet position to the next higher one and they also require a lot of force. This ratchets smoothly and the pressure you need to apply is never excessive. You will be able to cut through 2" branches with it.
customer_reviews.author: B. G.

customer_reviews.title: Strong Loppers!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! These seem like very high quality, strong loppers. Some reviewers state that the ratcheting mechanism takes awhile to get used to, but I found it easy to use right away. The loppers also work on limbs, branches, and saplings up to the size listed, so I'm also happy in that regard. Like any trimmers or loppers, they're not as easy to use when extended, but that's up to physics and geometry and not the fault of the product. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: JPfromOH

customer_reviews.title: Super Duty!!
customer_reviews.text: Super duty!!! Very nice product. Makes cutting branches a much easier job..I really do like the lopper... I broke the blade.. I e-mail Spear & Jackson on a Saturday night, they replied on Monday morning and I had a new Lopper at my house on Thursday.. They do stand by there warranty... I was impressed... I would like to see a thicker blade up to the cutting edge...
customer_reviews.author: toolman

customer_reviews.title: which is a good thing for my application which is to cut branches ...
customer_reviews.text: It does the job that I wanted to have done. The tool is very heavy duty and as such weighs more than I thought it would, which is a good thing for my application which is to cut branches up to one and one-half inches in diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Chang

customer_reviews.title: Cuts thick branches easily.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of leverage with these loppers. They will cut thick branches about 1-1/2" thick. The ratcheting mechanism "holds position" so you don't have to cut through the whole branch at once. The handles telescope for even greater leverage and to reach higher branches. Once handles are fully extended, though it's harder to get a full stroke on the handles if you're reaching a high branch.
customer_reviews.author: T.B.

customer_reviews.title: ratchets like a pipe cutter
customer_reviews.text: cuts through 2 inch honeysuckle base wood. This 105 Lb girl clears brush like a boss! The jaws open wide and then ratchet's pieces till they crack apart, fun sound, fun to be strong. The extension arms lock in place by twisting the knob at the end. Great tool for the money. I bring little fiskecs for the small stuff. That's the only adaption. Hate using power equipment. Love these.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Love these loppers
customer_reviews.text: Love these loppers! So much so, I cut a few branches that I probably should have left alone. But I was just having fun using them. Maybe I could trim the neighbor's trees too...
customer_reviews.author: BearsLeft

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy ratcheting mechanism, blade opens with a spring action that is deployed by spreading the handles, cuts limbs with little effort. It is heavier than my normal pruners, but the efficiency of my cuts saved me time. I pruned an oak tree and the blade is still sharp. Nice clean cuts with no tearing or stripping of the tree's bark. With the extension feature of the handles, I could reach more limbs without moving my ladder or climbing higher. I like the option of being able to replace the blade if I need to in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Once mastered, it has a wonderful cutting action, even for a "weak" older woman.
customer_reviews.text: It took me a few, maybe a dozen tries, to get the action of the tool. Once mastered it made cutting 1 inch plus branches a breeze. It does have a large area of movement that is needed so cutting thick branches should be done where there is room to open and close the head of the tool. This is so much better than typical loppers and should last a long time. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Old Mesquite Workshop

customer_reviews.title: A well made, powerful tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, powerful tool at a bargain price. With the leverage and ratchet action you will be surprised by the size limbs you can cut with just modest effort. I already own one and purchased a second as a gift for the young gal who helps us with our outdoor work once a week. She loves it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Shasta

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I really love these loppers. I love the telescoping handles. I am not super strong so these really increased my leverage to cut through pretty hefty branches. They are easy to use and I actually have fun cleaning up the yard
customer_reviews.author: jennifer mcd

customer_reviews.title: Have to open these loppers ALL THE WAY for even small cuts!! BUT excellent  cust service dept!
customer_reviews.text: Had to get used to having to open these shears ALL THE WAY OPEN for even the narrowest cut. Which really narrows your ability to get into tight spots. And just as I got used to that...they broke! Looks like a spring broke... and it is not reachable for the average person (with tools) !! Not happy. But !!! This co. Sent me an immediate replacement with no hassle. I believe it is a good tool...it just had a small, hopefully one time flaw. Impressed with their cust service dept!
customer_reviews.author: Just sayin!

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations. Have a ratchet hand loper and needed one for larger branches. As with all my other Spear and Jackson products this is well made.
customer_reviews.author: K. Waterman

customer_reviews.title: Muscle Saving Tool
customer_reviews.text: The Spear & Jackson lopper was a great buy! I am 74 and this lopper makes my job a lot easier. I've used it to cut down limbs for brush pickup in our neighborhood. The loppers saved me time and muscle power. They cut extremely well compared to other loppers I've purchased. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck D.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best anvil loppers out there!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best anvil loppers I have ever used! The robust build quality is superb and th design is light years ahead of others. The ratchet works smoothly and efficiently, amplifying the applied force to get the job done. Love 'em, love 'em, love 'em!
customer_reviews.author: PGH

customer_reviews.title: Great Lopper
customer_reviews.text: I had an older one I had bought years ago with the ratching action, took a chance on this one and worked out really well, Perfect for mid size limbs and small trees, not good for wider and real skinny takes some getting used to, used it alot in last two weeks and so far holding up well
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: My friend who is strong used these and said he ...
customer_reviews.text: My friend who is strong used these and said he didn't know the ratchet action was there every time. I used them and thought - wow! I can cut a 1 1/2 branch and not kill myself - heavy duty and worth the expense if you have pruning to do...
customer_reviews.author: Joce C.

customer_reviews.title: works well, but...
customer_reviews.text: works well, but the handle bent when using with handles extended... can not find replacement handles...
customer_reviews.author: Over 60 yr old consumer

customer_reviews.title: Long reach handles
customer_reviews.text: I love anvil type pruners for big cutting jobs. However I will mostly be using this pruner for cutting small weeds/trees near the ground in flower beds. I used a 1"OD by 3/8"ID nylon spacer inside the jaws secured by a 1/4" clevis pin to limit the amount the jaws will open so I only have to 'pump' them once. The long handles are great for cutting without too much stooping.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Telescopic Ratchet Anvil Loppers
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I only wish I had ordered these years ago. Pruning had become a terrible chore due to arthritic hands. These loppers are the best. I have cut 2" diameter wood with them. I'll have to control myself in the yard and not go crazy cutting things back.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne K. Chamberlin

customer_reviews.title: These loppers are the first class real deal. They ...
customer_reviews.text: These loppers are the first class real deal. They are quality not the cheap ones from China as sold by some retail outlets. Gave a second pair as a gift. They will cut a larger branch than stated if done carefullly. addendum: Handle (retracted) snapped off at the frame on a 1.5- 2 " green mimosa branch. (about 2.yr. 6mos.)
customer_reviews.author: A. R.

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy duty ratcheting anvil loppers
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction with no obvious failure points. Understand these are not your normal anvil loppers. The ratcheting mechanism produces a stronger/cleaner cut, but requires you to set the ratchet at an appropriate gap for the branch. This lopper is a little slower to use as a result.
customer_reviews.author: RJF

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Very good piece of equipment even for somebody who is not really into cutting tree branches, bushes and such. It can be a little tough to use in confined places, that would be my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Shipped on-time and as described
customer_reviews.text: Shipped on-time and as described. I purchased these to replace a pair that had been broken from misuse. The handle extends to reach high branches. It is are great for cutting off thick branches that are too small for a chainsaw and too big for hand pruners.
customer_reviews.author: BugMan

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the ratcheting mechanism on these cutters
customer_reviews.text: Don't like the ratcheting mechanism on these cutters. You have to open to the full open position every time even for small branches. They need to make it like their bypass cutters ratchet mechanism to make it better.
customer_reviews.author: rebelrick

customer_reviews.title: Lop, lop, lop
customer_reviews.text: I love these loppers. My cousin introduced me to hers. They are so much better than regular loppers. I will be 70 soon and do all of my yard work and I can do my large lopping so much faster and easier.
customer_reviews.author: lddpm5

customer_reviews.title: Work the risk
customer_reviews.text: I'm an older, out of shape woman who likes to do some yardwork. My upper body strength is not good and I have arthritic hands. This tool was a lifesaver when I need to prune a dwarf cherry tree. I was skeptical when I purchased it but was able to prune large limbs with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: JLBRN

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great. Very effective tool, amazingly precise and rugged construction. Does exactly what it says.
customer_reviews.author: Liazard

customer_reviews.title: Beastly Loppers!
customer_reviews.text: I have been through too many pairs of loppers over the years...primarily from me working them harder than they were designed for. So far, these things have stood up to the test of me! :D
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: The telescoping handles make it extra great, but the best part is the rachet function. You can cut a much larger amount but a small amount of energy. Whoever invented the rachet function, should be very rich.
customer_reviews.author: FlowerFreak

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for 3 days
customer_reviews.text: Where do I get warranty service? I have used these 3 days in the last few months and the gear is already stripped. Will not cut any longer. How do I get my 10 year warranty?
customer_reviews.author: G. L. WINKLER

customer_reviews.title: This thing is stronger and more useful than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I really use outdoor tools quite a bit. This thing is stronger and more useful than I expected. Take care of it and it will take care of you.
customer_reviews.author: Best To You

customer_reviews.title: Strong tree lopper
customer_reviews.text: Pruner has five stars but ten if allowed. Tree lopped in half the time I expected to finish the work. Amazingly strong tool and I would recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: EJ.

customer_reviews.title: Lumberjack worthy construction
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Solid construction, the telescoping feature works great and the blade is sharp. Only thing that would make them even better is if there was a way to switch to using them without the ratchet function so smaller pieces could be cut in a single action.
customer_reviews.author: G'ville Dave

customer_reviews.title: Ratchet loppers
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! I’m glad I bought them, there easy to use and get the job done fast with less strain on the wrists and arms. The fact that the handle length is adjustable is a huge plus! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: JoeG65

customer_reviews.title: Can cut bigger branches than any other shear I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Great cutters love the handle extentions for reaching further. I haven't had any problems with them and have trimmed branches over 3" though I wouldn't recommend that with the handles fully extended.
customer_reviews.author: Tyberious

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this purchase. We're trying to clean up a 5 acre property and we have a lot of thick, wild grape vines running everywhere. This thing makes getting rid of them MUCH easier!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Repeat order.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second set as we keep sending them to family & neighbors. Have had several others but find these hold up to larger projects without tearing your wrists & shoulders. Great item to carry in your truck if you are heading to the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy too lazy to return
customer_reviews.text: It is not intended for just normal trimming of a tree only if you're going to knock off a limb that is one to three inches around otherwise you're ratcheting forever just to prune a tree
customer_reviews.author: Laura Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great for the bigger limbs only
customer_reviews.text: Takes the same number of strokes for a small limb as a big one as its a ratchet style. It does go thru the big, over 1in, one’s with ease.
customer_reviews.author: MISkiman

customer_reviews.title: Cutting Blade broke after only 4 months of home garden use!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this from Amazon in mid April and here it is mid August and a big chunk broke off the loppers cutting blade today making it useless! When first purchased, I was amazed at how well it worked and loved it. But as a female gardener, using it for our home property was very disappointed, when the telescopic handles bent , then the blade broke. I believe the company should either refund my money or send me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: LYNN GIZEWSKI

customer_reviews.title: Good & Bad
customer_reviews.text: The ratchet feature to this item makes cutting large branches much easier, but it also makes it more difficult to cut the smaller ones where the feature isn't required. I wish there was a way to turn it on when you don't need it. Blade is very sharp and cuts extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long on smaller limbs
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, easy to cut, but the ratchet system on these are more work than help. Good for big limbs but sucks to ratchet over and over again for smaller limbs
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Seems good
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it will last, since I only received it yesterday. It cut several branches very easily. There was no need to use any force. It is not like a pair of shears. It has gears and you have to "pump" it to adjust the blade to fit the branch. So far, I like and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: starratercustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad and have got to use it too we're both impressed at its capabilitie and takes everything we put in its jaws I'd concider buying one for my self but do not have the same need for one right now but when I do I know what I'm buying
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Masters

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through like butter
customer_reviews.text: Just got it so can't say 100% on durability. One thing is it's a bit heavy. Otherwise, it cuts through 2" branches like butter. Smaller branches you have to ratchet wire a bit. Best one I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: SPC

customer_reviews.title: The best loppers
customer_reviews.text: These ratcheting loppers are way better than ones I've used before. Similar to ones my parents got from Samsclub years ago. Very sturdy, makes it easy to break down fallen tree limbs.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole7483

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I saw ratchet pruners on a garden show. Immediately knew I needed this tool. I'm a 72 yr old female and these are the boost my little arms need.
customer_reviews.author: JANEANN

customer_reviews.title: Ratcheting loppers are what you need
customer_reviews.text: These ratcheting loppers are excellent for use in cutting up tree limbs without causing you personal force or tiredness. Easy on the arms and muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Frank WIseman

customer_reviews.title: To clear thicker vines, you want a blade that closes easily.  Ratcheting blades fill the bill!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the ratcheting lopper, in order to replace a pair that just would not cut through vines in the back yard that I had to remove from the steps to my utility room. The first time I used the ratchet I was amazed at the ease of the cut through thick thorny vines. The blades lock closed which is a nice safety feature.
customer_reviews.author: OL-DOC

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 2 in 2017 for tree pruning.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased 2 of these loppers in 2017. Both performed perfectly until they failed. Second one was a broken weld. First was basic wear and tear with cutting. I have a good rating because of performance and price.
customer_reviews.author: glen

customer_reviews.title: ... nothing more to say other than these are the greatest. Superior quality
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing more to say other than these are the greatest. Superior quality, and they turn a tough cut into a simple job.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Appears well built - ratchet system is a muscle saver. can't say how durable it is - have only used it once.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Jayjock

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and rugged!
customer_reviews.text: This lopper is solidly built and well designed. It ratchets through really large limbs. It's heavy, so you want a light lopper to, but for the heavy stuff these work grat!
customer_reviews.author: heavyrunner the first

customer_reviews.title: These make hard work easy!
customer_reviews.text: I love these loppers. I bought them to try because my regular loppers were killing my arms and barely cutting. I am so happy I did. I can cut down mountains of branches very quickly and with hardly any arm strain.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: These seem better than any of the store purchased ones I have had
customer_reviews.text: I would have to have at least a year to give a proper report on these. Most brands only last me a year or two. It's winter so I have not used them much yet. They seem very strong
customer_reviews.author: Donald R. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: This is one heavy duty lopper , lightweight enough my petite wife can use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Loppers have proven to be durable, reliable, and have easily handled all types of wood (including hardwoods and bamboo).
customer_reviews.author: J W

customer_reviews.title: Highly Durable & Capable Product!
customer_reviews.text: These branch cutters (loppers) exceeded all our expectations. Easily capable of cutting branches equal to or exceeding advertised diameters!
customer_reviews.author: R. L.

customer_reviews.title: It will do the job!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool!! It’s a beast! Does the job so quick and well. I would recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: FranL

customer_reviews.title: Makes cutting easier
customer_reviews.text: These make cutting smaller branches easy, even if they are dry. The handles that extend are a help too.
customer_reviews.author: Charli

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought these since they were exactly like a pair my dad had bought at Sam's and I loved them. These are just like them. They are sturdy. Cut through good size branches. The ratcheting saves you from all the hard work. Love them, even my neighbor borrows them and wants a pair now.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Miller

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought myself these as a treat and what a treat they are!!! Heavy duty...sharp...precise!! I LOVE them!!!
customer_reviews.author: BL Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Cuts nicely but needs force & multiple strokes on the  larger diameters.
customer_reviews.text: I like the lockable handle extensions. It allows more freedom in setting the length needed vs the click method used on the set these replaced.
customer_reviews.author: SCClockDr

customer_reviews.title: Bought these after having an awesome experience with my father in laws
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after having an awesome experience with my father in laws. Same design however the lockout for extending the handles is different and more durable than his. Hope they last as long as his has. Got them quick and got to trimming. Saved alot of time too.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Fishel

customer_reviews.title: Huge but very powerful
customer_reviews.text: When I received these clippers, I was daunted by their size. But since them I have found them so useful for larger clipping needs. Because of their size they also make the higher projects accessible.
customer_reviews.author: islandgirl1056

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: So far the sturdines, and durability seem to be 5 star but haven't used long enough. Nice tool seems to be quality. I purchased this item when the price was very reasonable. Glad to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: SebastianI

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I was expecting.... Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Nagel

customer_reviews.title: cuts like it should
customer_reviews.text: Well built, cuts like it should. No complaints really, did see some moderate flex on the larger cuts, I imagine if I take it easy it will last a long time. If you abuse it however, I don't think it would hold up long, which is something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: TXTA

customer_reviews.title: Great Tree Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of the best tree trimmers on the market. I had one that lasted well over 10 years with heavy usage and just wore it out. I was happy to see Amazon was able to find this as I needed to replace my old one. I expect this to last another 10 + years.
customer_reviews.author: Roscoe the Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use. I was surprised at the ease of cutting tough limbs and brush. .
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: I actually like yard work now!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and does a fantastic job lopping off some nice-sized branches. Have used it several times already and have had no issues with it. Cleans up easy, too.
customer_reviews.author: Barney1

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Went into yard and found some branches to test unit. It did a great job. The ratcheting action is very effective, making even larger branches doable.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Ratchet is the only way to go
customer_reviews.text: I'm not real strong, and the ratchet helps keep the shears in place while I get more power with the next ratchet setting.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Gauby

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up well, broke, but was replaced with no hassles.
customer_reviews.text: ratchet stopped working, will not cut , only used 4 times on small branches, just clicks and slips. Not sure if the vendor will replace. Vendor replaced 2 days after I contacted them. Great customer service from the UK.

customer_reviews.text: I live alone on a one acre lot. It has lots of bushes and trees. This pruner is amazing. I now can cut/trim my trees and bushes. It is perfect for people who don't have a lot of upper arm strength.

product_meta.title: Spear & Jackson 8290RS Razorsharp Heavy Duty Telescopic Ratchet Anvil Loppers
product_meta.description: The spear & Jackson Razorsharp advance heavy duty telescopic ratchet anvil lopper features a ratchet action to allow for easier cutting in short steps, making this item ideal for cutting thicker and harder limbs. The PTFE coated sk5 carbon steel upper blade gives lasting sharpness and resistance to rust. The tubular aluminium handles are light yet strong and are finished with soft-feel non slip grips for comfort during use. Includes a locking catch for safe storage. This item has a 10 year guarantee. Spear & Jackson's foundations were laid in 1760, since our beginnings centuries of experience and innovation have resulted in the materials and development expertise that resides within the company today; and "continuous innovation" is at the heart of the company's ethos. This drive to improve product materials and performance can be seen in many different ways across the company's 3,000 lines. The organisation has come a long way since 1760, and the spear & Jackson group now manufactures and distributes garden tools, metrology equipment, woodworking tools, metal working tools, saw blades and magnetic equipment. With divisions across England, France and Australia, spear & Jackson is a world-wide brand, distributing products throughout the world. Our tools are manufactured to a high quality standard and offer superb service and longevity; guaranteed against defects in manufacturing, subject to normal wear & tear and the provision of reasonable care and maintenance. This does not affect your statutory rights.
feature_bullets: Ratchet action allows for easier cutting in short steps - ideal for cutting thicker, harder branches
Sk5 carbon steel upper blade for lasting sharpness
Ptfe coated blade for rust resistance
Light yet strong tubular telescopic aluminum handles, soft feel non slip grips for comfort, locking catch for safe storage
Eclipse professional tools have been selling since 1909
